HelpXML.Title: OPTc
HelpXML.Purpose: OPTc computes breakdown point and efficiency associated with constant c for Optimal rho function

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator

Item.Name: v
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression v=1)

Item.Name: shapeeff
Item.LongDesc: If shapeeff=1, the efficiency is referred to the shape else (default) is referred to the location estimator

Item.Name: bdp
Item.LongDesc: Breakdown point associated to the supplied value of c

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Efficiency associated to the supplied value of c

Item.Name: approxsheff
Item.LongDesc: Approximate value of efficiency in case input option shapeeff=1 and v>1. This output is left for comparability with the value which comes out from R library robustbase.

HelpXML.MoreAbout: $\rho$ ($\psi$) function which is considered is standardized using intervals 0---(2/3)c , (2/3)c---c, >c. $\rho$ function is \[ TBrho(u)= \left\{ \begin{array}{lr} 1.3846 \left(\frac{u}{c}\right)^2 & |\frac{u}{c}| \leq \frac{2}{3} \\ 0.5514-2.6917 \left(\frac{u}{c}\right)^2 +10.7668\left(\frac{u}{c}\right)^4-11.6640\left(\frac{u}{c}\right)^6+4.0375\left(\frac{u}{c}\right)^8 & \qquad \frac{2}{3} \leq |\frac{u}{c}|\leq 1 \\ 1 & |\frac{u}{c}|>1 \\ \end{array} \right. \] |t/c|>1 Therefore, the input c for the (rho) psi function above corresponds to c/3 in the rho (psi) function defined in the interval 0---2c, 2c---3c, >3c

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York. |t/c|>1

MATLABcode.ItemCell: %Analysis of breakdown point and asymptotic efficiency
%at the normal distribution as a function of c in regression.
